description:
I thought about this while reviewing:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/184153/6/nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py

Currently the ImageMeta.disk_format field is a string field so anything can go in there, regardless of whether or not nova can handle it in the virt driver layer.

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/objects/image_meta.py#n63

It seems this would be a whitelist that we could figure out and turn into an enum, so we should do that if possible.
title: There should be a nova.objects.fields.DiskFormatEnum for the ImageMeta.disk_format field

comments.content:
I thought about this while reviewing:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/184153/6/nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py

Currently the ImageMeta.disk_format field is a string field so anything can go in there, regardless of whether or not nova can handle it in the virt driver layer.

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/objects/image_meta.py#n63

It seems this would be a whitelist that we could figure out and turn into an enum, so we should do that if possible.

Author: jichenjc <email address hidden>
Date:   Mon Sep 21 23:47:46 2015 +0800

    Add test cases for some classes in objects.fields
    
    There is no unit test for some classes in objects.fields
    This patch added unit tests for PciDeviceTypeField
    ConfigDrivePolicy and CPUAllocationPolicy.

commit fac00f0feabdc16be8b20fac731ab9dfd967f655
Author: jichenjc <email address hidden>
Date:   Mon Sep 21 22:53:12 2015 +0800

    Add DiskFormat as Enum in fields
    
    Currently the ImageMeta.disk_format field is a string
    field so anything can go in there, regardless of whether
    or not nova can handle it in the virt driver layer.
    Turn this into a Enum in the object layer.
    
    Change-Id: Icc30d3b38c410d0c8b47b077fbe0a8c7bb6268e4
    Partial-Bug: 1489531

comments.content: Removing jichenjc as assignee because it's been over 2 weeks and no patch has been submitted (other than the abandoned one). If you still wish to work on this bug, feel free to reassign to yourself and/or push a new patch.
